tag_get_asset_ids: With this function you can get all the assets of a given type that have the given tags assigned to them. You supply either a single tag (as a string) or an array, where each item in the array is a tag (as a string), as well as the type of asset to check. the type of asset should be one of the following constants:
The given name refers to an object.
The given name refers to a sprite.
The given name refers to a sound.
The given name refers to a room.
The given name refers to a tile set.
The given name refers to a path.
The given name refers to a script.
The given name refers to a font.
The given name refers to a time line.
The given name refers to a shader.
The given name refers to an Animation Curve.
The given name refers to a Sequence.
The function will return an array, where each item in the array will be a single asset index value. If there are no assets of the type that have the given tag(s), an empty array will be returned.
A single asset tag string or an array with various asset tags.

{ANY_CODE} var _paths = tag_get_asset_ids("enemy", asset_path);
var _num = irandom(array_length(_paths) - 1);
path_start(_paths[_num], 1, path_action_reverse, false);
The above code uses the tag "enemy" to find all the path assets with that tag, before choosing one at random and assigning it to the instance running the code.
